section.verse: The vision of Obadiah. Thus says the LORD God Is. 21:11; Ezek. 25:12; Joel 3:19; Mal. 1:3concerning Edom Jer. 49:14–16; Obad. 1–4(We have heard a report from the LORD, And a messenger has been sent among the nations, saying, “Arise, and let us rise up against her for battle”):
“Behold, I will make you small among the nations; You shall be greatly despised.

The Is. 16:6; Jer. 49:16pride of your heart has deceived you, You who dwell in the clefts of the rock, Whose habitation is high; Is. 14:13–15; Rev. 18:7You who say in your heart, ‘Who will bring me down to the ground?’
Job 20:6Though you ascend as high as the eagle, And though you Hab. 2:9; Mal. 1:4set your nest among the stars, From there I will bring you down,” says the LORD.

“If Jer. 49:9thieves had come to you, If robbers by night— Oh, how you will be cut off!— Would they not have stolen till they had enough? If grape-gatherers had come to you, Deut. 24:21Would they not have left some gleanings?
“Oh, how Esau shall be searched out! How his hidden treasures shall be sought after!

All the men in your confederacy hall force you to the border; Jer. 38:22The men at peace with you Shall deceive you and prevail against you. Those who eat your bread shall lay a trap for you. Is. 19:11; Jer. 49:7No one is aware of it.
“Will(Job 5:12–14); Is. 29:14 I not in that day,” says the LORD, “Even destroy the wise men from Edom, And understanding from the mountains of Esau?
Then your Ps. 76:5mighty men, O Gen. 36:11; 1 Chr. 1:45; Job 2:11; Jer. 49:7Teman, shall be dismayed, To the end that everyone from the mountains of Esau May be cut off by slaughter.

section.title: Edom Mistreated His Brother
section.verse: “For Gen. 27:41; Ezek. 25:12; Amos 1:11violence against your brother Jacob, Shame shall cover you, And Ezek. 35:9; Joel 3:19you shall be cut off forever.

In the day that you Ps. 83:5–8; Amos 1:6, 9stood on the other side— In the day that strangers carried captive his forces, When foreigners entered his gates And Joel 3:3; Nah. 3:10cast lots for Jerusalem— Even you were as one of them.

“But you should not have Mic. 4:11; 7:10gazed on the day of your brother In the day of his captivity; Nor should you have (Prov. 17:5); Ezek. 35:15; 36:5rejoiced over the children of Judah In the day of their destruction; Nor should you have spoken proudly In the day of distress.

You should not have entered the gate of My people In the day of their calamity. Indeed, you should not have gazed on their affliction In the day of their calamity, Nor laid hands on their substance In the day of their calamity.
You should not have stood at the crossroads To cut off those among them who escaped; Nor should you have delivered up those among them who remained In the day of distress.

“ForEzek. 30:3; (Joel 1:15; 2:1, 11, 31; Amos 5:18, 20) the day of the LORD upon all the nations is near; Jer. 50:29; 51:56; Hab. 2:8As you have done, it shall be done to you; Your reprisal shall return upon your own head.
Joel 3:17For as you drank on My holy mountain, So shall all the nations drink continually; Yes, they shall drink, and swallow, And they shall be as though they had never been.

section.title: Israel’s Final Triumph
section.verse: “But on Mount Zion there Is. 14:1, 2; Joel 2:32; Amos 9:8shall be deliverance, And there shall be holiness; The house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.

The house of Jacob shall be a fire, And the house of Joseph Is. 5:24; 9:18, 19; Zech. 12:6a flame; But the house of Esau shall be stubble; They shall kindle them and devour them, And no survivor shall remain of the house of Esau,” For the LORD has spoken.

The South Is. 11:14; Amos 9:12shall possess the mountains of Esau, Zeph. 2:7And the Lowland shall possess Philistia. They shall possess the fields of Ephraim And the fields of Samaria. Benjamin shall possess Gilead.

And the captives of this host of the children of Israel Shall possess the land of the Canaanites As 1 Kin. 17:9; Luke 4:26far as Zarephath. The captives of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad Jer. 32:44Shall possess the cities of the South.
Then (James 5:20)saviors shall come to Mount Zion To judge the mountains of Esau, And the Ps. 22:28; (Dan. 2:44; 7:14; Zech. 14:9; Rev. 11:15)kingdom shall be the LORD’s.

Greeting
section.verse: Paul, a Eph. 3:1prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved friend and fellow laborer,
to the beloved Apphia, Col. 4:17Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the LORD Jesus Christ.

section.title: Philemon’s Love and Faith
section.verse: Eph. 1:16; 1 Thess. 1:22; Thess. 1:3I thank my God, making mention of you always in my prayers,
Eph. 1:15; Col. 1:4; 1 Thess. 3:6hearing of your love and faith which you have toward the LORD Jesus and toward all the saints,
that the sharing of your faith may become effective Phil. 1:9; (Col. 1:9; 3:10; James 2:14–17)by the acknowledgment of (1 Thess. 5:18)every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
For we have great joy and consolation in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, brother.

section.title: The Plea for Onesimus
section.verse: Therefore, though I might be very bold in Christ to command you what is fitting,
yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you—being such a one as Paul, the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ—
I appeal to you for my son Col. 4:9Onesimus, whom I have begotten while in my chains,
who once was unprofitable to you, but now is profitable to you and to me.
I am sending him back. You therefore receive him, that is, my own heart,
whom I wished to keep with me, that on your behalf he might minister to me in my chains for the gospel.
But without your consent I wanted to do nothing, 2 Cor. 9:7; 1 Pet. 5:2that your good deed might not be by compulsion, as it were, but voluntary.
For perhaps he departed for a while for this purpose, that you might receive him forever,
no longer as a slave but more than a slave—a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the Eph. 6:5; Col. 3:22flesh and in the LORD.
